feat.name: Bomb Thrower
entries: A bomb for the purposes of this feat is a handheld object that deals damage by exploding or chemically affecting a target, such as an {@item Acid (vial)|PHB|acid flask}, {@item Alchemist's Fire (flask)|PHB|alchemist's fire}, {@item Holy Water (flask)|PHB|holy water}, {@item Fragmentation Grenade|DMG|grenades}, and so forth.
You gain the following benefits:

items: You add your proficiency bonus to hit with any thrown weapon, including an improvised thrown weapon.

When you hit with a bomb, you can make a second attack roll against another target within range and within 5 feet of the original target. If you hit the second target, you deal damage equal to your Dexterity modifier (if any) of the same type as the bomb to the secondary target.
If a creature has to make a saving throw against a bomb thrown by you, the DC is equal to 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus.

item.name: Ovinrbaane, Enemy of All Enemies
entries: Ovinrbaane (literally translated as "enemy of all enemies") is a powerful but cursed greatsword.

entries.name: Magic Weapon
entries: Ovinrbaane is a magic weapon that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The greatsword also functions as a {@item ring of free action|DMG} and a {@item sword of wounding|DMG}.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: Ovinrbaane has the following properties (you can swap these out for similar random properties if you so desire):

items: While you are attuned to the sword and wielding it, you can use an action to cast {@spell bless}. After you cast the spell, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1–5, you can't cast it again until the next dawn. (1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property)

While you are attuned to the sword and wielding it, the sword can cast {@spell dispel magic} to attempt to remove an undesirable spell effect as soon as it affects you. Whether or not this is successful, after it occurs, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 1–5, the sword can't do this again until the next dawn. (1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property)

Over the course of time, the sword modifies its wielder's memories to mislead its wielder into believing they're the real Armag and that anyone around them who isn't obviously a member of their clan is a mortal enemy. The cursed greatsword also slowly changes the features of the wielder over the course of several days or even weeks to appear as those of the original Armag. If left unchecked, these powers seemingly bring the warlord back to life—it's the wait for this subtle transformation to be complete that's kept Armag in "meditation" in this chamber for so long. (1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental} property)

entries.name: Curse
entries: The sword bears a curse that affects any creature that becomes attuned to it. Even if the attunement ends, the curse remains. The sword's curse functions as that caused by a {@item berserker axe|DMG}, but also transforms the user's body and mind.

entries.name: Destroying Ovinrbaane
entries: Ovinrbaane is dedicated to the slaying of all life, and can't be destroyed unless it is brought to the Boneyard and used to strike three blows against Armag's own gravestone, causing the sword to shatter.

item.name: Stag's Helm
entries: This striking helmet is crafted to resemble the skull of a mighty stag; although made from bone, the antlers and helm are as strong as metal. When worn in a forest or similar terrain, the helm greatly enhances your eyesight and hearing, granting you advantage to Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or sound.

entries.name: Insightful Shot
entries: Once per day, you can activate the helm as a bonus action to gain advantage on your next ranged attack. A worshipper of Erastil can use this ability up to three times per day instead.

monster.name: Adamantine Golem

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Destructive Strike
entries: The adamantine golem's slam attacks score a critical hit on a 19 or 20, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is damaged and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The adamantine golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The adamantine golem is immune to any spell of 5th level or lower.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The adamantine golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The adamantine golem regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. It can only be permanently destroyed if reduced to 0 hit points and then decapitated using an adamantine weapon—alternatively a {@spell wish} spell can be used to slay it while it is at 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The adamantine golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 2d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Reactive Movement
entries: The adamantine golem moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Slam Attack
entries: The adamantine golem makes a slam attack.

legendary.name: Charging Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The adamantine golem moves up to its walking speed and targets each creature within 5 feet of it during its movement. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw with disadvantage or take 29 ({@damage 3d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. Until the start of its next turn, all attacks against the adamantine golem have advantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ankou's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The ankou can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The ankou's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Shadow Doubles (1/Day)
entries: The ankou summons 4 shadow copies which appear within 60 feet of the ankou and remain for 6 rounds. The copies act on the ankou's initiative, have 20% of the ankou's current hit points, can make only one claw attack on its turn, and have none of the ankou's other special abilities or spellcasting. A copy disappears if the ankou is ever more than 120 feet away, or {@condition unconscious}, or if a {@spell light}, {@spell daylight|PHB|sunlight}, or similar spell illuminates it.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The ankou deals an extra 13 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the ankou that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the ankou doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ankou makes two attacks: one with its claw and one with its wing.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, 5 feet reach, one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, 10 ft. reach, one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ankou assassin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The ankou assassin can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the ankou assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the ankou assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The ankou assassin's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Shadow Doubles (1/Day)
entries: The ankou assassin summons 4 shadow copies which appear within 60 feet of the ankou and remain for 6 rounds. The copies act on the ankou's initiative, have 20% of the ankou's current hit points, can make only one claw attack on its turn, and have none of the ankou's other special abilities or spellcasting. A copy disappears if the ankou is ever more than 120 feet away, or {@condition unconscious}, or if a {@spell light}, {@spell daylight|PHB|sunlight}, or similar spell illuminates it.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The ankou assassin deals an extra 31 ({@damage 9d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the ankou assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the ankou assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ankou assassin makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its wings.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) slashing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The antipaladin is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The antipaladin casts this spell on itself before combat if able.

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: When the antipaladin hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can expend one spell slot to deal 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. If the antipaladin expends a slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 4 ({@dice 1d8}) for each level above 1st.

trait.name: Menacing Monologue
entries: As a bonus action, the antipaladin can deliver a magically enhanced menacing speech that inspires fear in their enemies. Each creature of the antipaladin's choice within 60 feet that can hear the antipaladin must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened} until the end of the antipaladin's next turn. On a successful save, that creature is immune to the antipaladin's Menacing Monologue for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The antipaladin makes two attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: Assassin vines have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks when hiding among foliage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). A {@condition grappled} target automatically takes 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the assassin vine's turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The athach makes any combination of two claw or slam attacks and one bite attack, or two rock attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} for one hour. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Thrown Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The aurumvorax has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Metal Eater
entries: An aurumvorax can bypass the damage thresholds, damage resistance, and immunities of a construct or object so long as either is made of metal.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the aurumvorax moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the aurumvorax can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aurumvorax makes two claw attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Lockjaw
entries: While grappling a creature the aurumvorax makes one bite attack which automatically hits and four claw attacks against the {@condition grappled} creature.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage on a hit the aurumvorax {@action grapple|PHB|grapples} the target (escape {@dc 15}).

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Breach
entries: If the worm has moved at least 10 feet underwater this turn, it can leap vertically out of the water up to 30 feet and make a bite attack at a creature within range. After the attack, the worm splashes back down into the water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worm makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail stinger.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.

If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) piercing damage, and the target must attempt a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Thrash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Reactive Thrash
entries: When the azure worm is hit by a melee attack, the azure worm can use its reaction to make a thrash attack against the attacking creature, flailing out with its entire body to slam and pound against a foe so foolish as to attack them in close combat.

trait.name: Bounding Charge
entries: The bandersnatch is unaffected by {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

trait.name: Frumious
entries: The bandersnatch seethes with barely repressed rage and anger. If it misses with its bite attack or falls below half of its hit points, it succumbs to such uncontrollable fury that it bursts into eerily colored flame. While engulfed in these flames, a bandersnatch is affected as by a {@spell haste} spell (this effect can't be dispelled) and deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage with each of its attacks. The fury lasts for 5 rounds, after which the bandersnatch can't enter a fury again for another 5 rounds.

trait.name: Gaze
entries: A bandersnatch can direct its gaze attack against a single foe within 30 feet as a bonus action. That creature must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, becoming confused (as per the {@spell confusion} spell) for 1 minute on a failure, or {@condition restrained} for 1 round on a success. A creature confused by this ability can make a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect early.

trait.name: Hard to Kill (1/Day)
entries: Through sheer force of will, a bandersnatch revives itself from a violent death. When reduced to 0 hit points, the bandersnatch is returned to life with 1 hit point at the start of its next turn, unless it was killed by a critical hit.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The bandersnatch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Planar Acclimation
entries: The bandersnatch always treats the plane it is currently on as its native plane.

trait.name: Quick Recovery
entries: A debilitated frumious bandersnatch recovers with frightening speed. If a bandersnatch starts its turn affected by any or all of the following conditions, these conditions end at the end of its turn: {@spell confusion|PHB|confused}, any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, {@condition poisoned}, and {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Relentless Tracker
entries: A Bandersnatch can move at up to double its speed and still track without penalty. It gains advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made to track creatures it has wounded.

trait.name: Tail Quills
entries: The bandersnatch has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the bandersnatch finishes a long rest.

A creature attempting to remove a lodged quill must use an action to perform {@dc 20} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. On a failed check, the quill is still removed but the process causes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage to the victim. On a success, the quill is safely removed. If the check succeeds by 5 or more, an additional quill can be removed.

trait.name: Vicious Tenacity
entries: If damage reduces the bandersnatch to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw equal to the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit. On a success, the bandersnatch drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bandersnatch makes three attacks: two with its claws, and one with either its bite or its tail slap.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the bandersnatch cannot use its bite on another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Quills
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 300 ft., up to four creatures that can be no more than 30 ft. apart. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d8}) piercing damage and the creature is {@condition poisoned} until the quill is removed.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) piercing damage and the creature must succeed a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or have a quill lodged in its flesh, and is {@condition poisoned} until the quill is removed.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The bandersnatch moves a distance equal to its full movement without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The bandersnatch makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Tail Slap (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bandersnatch makes a tail slap attack.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The blodeuwedd's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). The monster can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Allergen Aura
entries: The blodeuwedd exudes an aura of pollen and irritating allergens that forces living creatures who start their turn within 30 feet to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition poisoned}, coughing and sneezing for {@dice 1d6} rounds. A blodeuwedd can suppress or initiate this aura as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The blodeuwedd can use its action to polymorph into a single, unique Medium humanoid or an {@creature owl}. Other than its size, the blodeuwedd's statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. A blodeuwedd reverts to its true form upon death.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blodeuwedd makes two attacks with its claws or sling.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bloom cultist is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The bloom cultist has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the bloom cultist deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the cleansed cultist that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the cleansed cultist doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Kukri
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Dart (6/Day)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6 + 3}) acid damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bloomborn athach makes any combination of two claw or slam attacks and one bite attack, or two rock attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw; on a failed saving throw the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} for one hour, and on a success, the target takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Thrown Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 4d12 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Death Aura
entries: The bodak confers disadvantage on all death saving throws to creatures within 60 feet. A humanoid creature that dies within this aura rises as an autonomous {@creature bodak|PKB} 24 hours after its death.

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The bodak can sense life up to 60 feet away as if it had {@sense blindsight}.

trait.name: Draining Glance
entries: Creatures that start their turns within 30 feet of the bodak and can see the bodak must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a success.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the bodak until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the bodak in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: If the bodak is exposed to sunlight, it gains disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

Additionally, each round that the bodak is exposed to sunlight causes it to gain a level of {@condition exhaustion}, destroying the bodak when it has 6 levels. If the bodak leaves the sunlight before being destroyed, it loses one level of {@condition exhaustion} for each minute it spends in darkness.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bodak makes a claw attack and uses its death gaze.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Death Gaze
entries: The bodak stares at a living creature within 30 feet that it can sense with detect life. That creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage, and reduces its hit point maximum by an amount equal to the damage taken. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and does not have its hit point maximum reduced. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The creature dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The bog strider can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Tremor Tap
entries: Bog striders can send and receive messages by creating and sensing silent vibrations on the surface of any body of water they currently tread. The range of communication extends outward 120 feet to all other bog striders within line of effect on or under the water. Because the ripples created on the water prove omni-directional, bog striders can communicate with multiple targets at the same time. Only bog striders can understand this form of communication. This ability also grants the bog strider {@sense tremorsense} in water at a range of 120 feet.

trait.name: Water Sprint (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The bog strider can move up to 5 times its normal speed (250 feet) on water when making a charge or retreating from an enemy. Once it decides to increase its movement in this fashion, the effect lasts for up to 4 rounds, after which the bog strider gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

trait.name: Water Stride
entries: The bog strider can tread upon rivers, lakes, and flooded swamplands or marshes as if under the effects of the {@spell water walk} spell. It also gains an increased movement rate by using the surface tension and its multiple legs to propel itself across the water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bog strider makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw or spear.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage when used with two hands.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The boggard cultist is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its primary spellcasting ability is Wisdom ({@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The boggard cultist has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Swamp Stride
entries: The boggard cultist ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3} when in swamp terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boggard cultist can use Gogunta's croak. The cultist then makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Whip +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Blowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 25/100. {@h}6 piercing damage plus the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target creature is {@condition restrained}, and the boggard can't use its tongue attack.

action.name: Gogunta's Croak
entries: The boggard cultist unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. A creature that fails this saving throw by 5 or more must use its movement on its turn to move away from the boggard cultist that used Gogunta's croak. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this boggard cultist's croak for 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The boggard swampseer is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its primary spellcasting ability is Wisdom ({@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The boggard swampseer has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Swamp Stride
entries: The boggard swampseer ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3} when in swamp terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boggard swampseer can use its terrifying croak. It then makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the boggard swampseer can't use its tongue attack.

action.name: Terrifying Croak
entries: The boggard swampseer unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this boggard swampseer's terrifying croak for 24 hours.

action.name: Destructive Croak {@recharge 5}
entries: The boggard swampseer utters a powerful croak to every creature in a 15- foot radius. Affected creatures must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the boggard swampseer has a creature {@condition grappled} with its tongue, that creature has disadvantage on its saving throw against the destructive croak.

reaction.name: Drowning Drone
entries: When the boggard swampseer or one of its allies within 60 feet fails its saving throw against a sound-based spell, the boggard swampseer can make a {@skill performance} roll to create a deafening croak. The saving throw can be rerolled, and the higher of the two results is used.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The boggard warden is a 2nd-level spellcaster. The boggard warden's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following ranger spells prepared:

trait.name: Swamp Track
entries: Boggard wardens are unhindered by natural {@quickref difficult terrain||3} in swamps or bogs. They are still affected by magical {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boggard warden makes one trident attack, one handaxe attack, and one tongue attack.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage or 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage when held with two hands, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Blowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 25/100 ft., one target. {@h}6 piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} rounds on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the boggard warden can't use its tongue attack.

trait.name: Swamp Stride
entries: The boggard warrior ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3} when in swamp terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boggard warrior can use its terrifying croak, then makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 10/30 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the boggard warrior can't use its tongue attack.

action.name: Terrifying Croak
entries: The boggard warrior unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this boggard warrior's terrifying croak for 24 hours.

trait.name: Favored Enemy (beasts and humans)
entries: The bounty hunter gains advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to search for their favored enemies and on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track them.

trait.name: Precision Edge
entries: The first time the bounty hunter hits their favored enemy in a round, they deal an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Rapid Reloading
entries: The bounty hunter ignores the loading property of crossbows with which they are proficient.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bounty hunter makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The bugbear deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the bugbear that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the bugbear doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Twin Feint
entries: If the bugbear hits a creature with its first attack on a turn, it has advantage on its next attack against the same creature that turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bugbear makes two dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 10/30 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage in melee or 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage at range.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The bugbear adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the bugbear must see the attacker and be wielding two melee weapons.

monster.name: Bythos Aeon
languages: telepathy 100 ft. (can communicate with living creatures that do not have language)

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bythos's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). The bythos can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Confusing Gaze
entries: A creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the bythos must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is confused until the end of its next turn, {@spell confusion|PHB|as per the spell of the same name}. A creature that successfully saves is immune to this bythos's confusing gaze for the next 24 hours. This is a magical effect, and immunity or protection against being {@condition charmed} apply.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The bythos's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The bythos regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Temporal Reversion (1/Day)
entries: If the bythos fails a saving throw, it can choose to reroll the saving throw. If it does, it must use the new roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bythos makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage. If a creature is hit by two or more of the bythos's slam attacks in one turn, that creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it ages {@dice 1d10} years and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. On a successful save, the target is immune to the aging and {@condition exhaustion} effects of the bythos's slam attack for the next 24 hours.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't cold iron

trait.name: Creature of Primal Magic
entries: The cairn linnorm is constantly under the effects of {@spell freedom of movement}.

trait.name: Curse of the Crooked Cane
entries: A creature that slays a cairn linnorm must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become cursed with one level of {@condition exhaustion}, or two if the creature fails by 5 or more on the saving throw. This {@condition exhaustion} can be removed only after the curse ends. Also, while cursed, the creature ages at a rate of 1 year per day.

trait.name: Draconic Nature
entries: The cairn linnorm does not age, and magic can't put the linnorm to sleep.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the cairn linnorm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cairn linnorm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The cairn linnorm regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the cairn linnorm takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The cairn linnorm dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cairn linnorm makes four attacks: two with its claws, one with its bite, and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d4 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The cairn linnorm exhales eldritch acid in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 19d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The linnorm makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The linnorm makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Stoke the Fires (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The linnorm focuses its internal acid gland, allowing it to roll immediately to recharge its breath weapon.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the catoblepas moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The catoblepas has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature other than a catoblepas that starts its turn within 10 feet of the catoblepas must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of any catoblepas for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The catoblepas makes one hooves attack, one gore attack, and one tail attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 5d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the catoblepas and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The catoblepas exhales its horrid, stinking breath in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 63 ({@damage 14d8}) poison damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this breath.

monster.name: Cauthooj
languages: understands Sylvan but can't speak any language

trait.name: Staccato Strike
entries: As a bonus action, the cauthooj uses subtle alterations in the pitch and tone of its song to direct one creature confused by its Warbling Song to make an attack against a target the cauthooj chooses. If no target is in reach or range, or the creature is unable to attack for any other reason, this ability has no effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cauthooj uses its Warbling Song, then makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Warbling Song
entries: The cauthooj gives a strange, ululating cry that causes nearby creatures to lash out violently and without control. Each creature within 120 feet that can hear the cauthooj must succeed on a {@dc 16} saving throw or be confused (as per the {@spell confusion} spell) until the end of the cauthooj's next turn.

reaction.name: Hop-Dodge
entries: When the cauthooj is the target of a melee attack and is adjacent to another enemy that is also within the reach of the melee attack, the cauthooj nimbly hops aside, redirecting the attack against the adjacent enemy. The cauthooj then moves up to half its speed, not provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|attacks of opportunity}.

trait.name: Charge
entries: Once per turn, if the centaur scout moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee spear attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur scout makes two attacks: one with its spear and one with its hooves.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The cleansed cultist has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the cleansed cultist deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the cleansed cultist that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the cleansed cultist doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cleansed cultist makes three attacks: two with its shortsword and one with its dagger.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Release the Inmost Worm {@recharge 5}
entries: The cleansed cultist spends an action to expel a bloody worm from the scar on its forehead, targeting a creature within 30 feet. The creature must succeed at a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or the worm burrows into the creature's head, dealing 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and incapacitating the target until the beginning of the cleansed cultist's next turn. On a successful save, the worm deals half damage and falls to the ground, vanishing, and the target is not {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Chittering Screech
entries: A derghodaemon can grind its mandibles and chitin plates together to form a distended and cacophonous scraping noise that can drive a mortal being insane. Anyone within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be affected by a {@spell symbol} spell (insanity). A creature that makes this save is immune to this derghodaemon's screech for 24 hours.

trait.name: Cloud of Misery
entries: A derghodaemon is surrounded at all times by an insect swarm (as the spell {@spell insect plague}) extending 5 feet from its space and moving with it without requiring {@status concentration}. The area surrounding the daemon is lightly obscured and acts as {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, as well as damaging all creatures adjacent to the daemon when it ends its movement. As a bonus action, it can {@status concentration|PHB|concentrate} to move the swarm away from itself up to 60 feet away, forming it into a 10-foot-radius sphere. It can move the swarm up to 60 feet each round thereafter as a bonus action to any point within 60 feet of itself. If it stops {@status concentration||concentrating}, the swarm disperses and reforms around the daemon at the beginning of its next turn. If the daemon takes 20 or more damage from an area effect while surrounded by the swarm, it is dispersed until the daemon uses a bonus action to reform it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: A derghodaemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: See Invisible
entries: A derghodaemon can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as if they were {@condition invisible}. It can see Ethereal creatures or objects, though they appear ghostly and translucent.

trait.name: Tearing Rend
entries: If a derghodaemon hits a creature with 2 or more claws in the same round, it deals an additional 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage. As a bonus action, it can increase this bonus damage to 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage and cause the target to gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} (as long as the target has no other levels of {@condition exhaustion}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The derghodaemon makes five claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The doprillu's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mask of Power
entries: If the doprillu's mask is removed, it loses its regeneration abilities, its immunity to {@condition exhaustion} and being {@condition incapacitated}, and it immediately gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. If the doprillu puts the mask back on, it regains its abilities and loses all levels of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature can pull off the doprillu's mask with a successful {@dc 20} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

trait.name: Otherworldly Perception
entries: The doprillu can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as if they were visible.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The doprillu regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the doprillu takes cold damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the doprillu's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The doprillu makes three fist attacks, or if it has a {@condition grappled} creature, it makes two body strikes and a fist attack. Alternatively, if the doprillu makes a whirlwind throw, it makes a body strike as a ranged attack immediately afterward.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns, and the doprillu can't {@action grapple} another target.

action.name: Body Strike
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/50 ft., one creature. {@h}the doprillu uses a Medium or smaller creature it is {@action grapple|PHB|grappling} to strike another creature and deals 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage to the target and half as much damage to the {@condition grappled} creature.

action.name: Whirlwind Throw
entries: The doprillu whirls a {@condition grappled} creature, using it to strike all creatures within 10 feet of the doprillu. All creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. The {@condition grappled} creature takes half the amount of damage taken by each creature struck.

trait.name: Hide in Plain Sight
entries: While the drainberry bush remains motionless, it gains advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to appear to be an ordinary bush.

trait.name: Nature Empathy
entries: The drainberry bush can speak telepathically with animals and sentient plant creatures (as {@spell speak with animals}).

trait.name: Blood Berries
entries: The drainberry bush must drain blood from living creatures for sustenance. This causes clusters of bright red, highly nutritious berries to grow among its branches. Each cluster of berries lasts for 1 day, and a drainberry bush typically has 3 ({@dice 1d4 + 1}) clusters when encountered. When consumed, a cluster restores 14 ({@dice 2d8 + 5}) hit points and removes one level of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature can pluck a cluster of berries with a successful unarmed melee attack or Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check against the bush's AC. (If the drainberry bush is not hostile, it is also possible to purchase blood berries from it at a typical price of 200 gp per cluster.)

trait.name: Consume Berries
entries: As a bonus action, the bush draws nourishment from one cluster of its own blood berries, regaining 14 ({@dice 2d8 + 5}) hit points. That berry cluster wrinkles and dies.

trait.name: Drain Blood
entries: As a bonus action, if it has {@condition grappled} at least one creature, the drainberry bush can use its hollow thorns to siphon blood from the {@condition grappled} creatures. For each {@condition grappled} creature, a new cluster of blood berries immediately grows on the drainberry bush. All creatures {@condition grappled} by the drainberry bush have some of their blood taken and must attempt a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw to resist the effects of blood loss. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) necrotic damage and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drainberry bush makes three attacks with its vines.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

trait.name: Devoted to Drelev
entries: A Drelev guard has advantage on saving throws against effects that would force them to abandon their duty to Drelev.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guard makes three attacks with his longsword or longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Dweomercat

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dweomercat's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The dweomercat can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The dweomercat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dweomercat has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rake
entries: If a dweomercat hits with both claw attacks, or with one claw attack and its bite, it can make an extra claw attack as a bonus action. It has disadvantage on the attack roll for this claw attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dweomercat makes two claw attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pouncing Spring
entries: If the dweomercat moves at least 10 feet before attacking and this attack hits, it can choose to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. If it chooses to forgo this extra damage, its movement after attacking does not provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|attacks of opportunity}.

reactionHeader: Whenever a dweomercat is subjected to a spell effect or is in the area of effect for a spell, as a reaction it can use one of the following reactions. The dweomercat is still affected by the spell.

reaction.name: Dweomer Leap
entries: The dweomercat teleports to an unoccupied space adjacent to the caster and makes a single melee attack.

reaction.name: Spell Link
entries: The dweomercat gains one of the following spell effects, depending on the school of the spell. If an active spell effect requires {@status concentration}, it ends if the dweomercat uses this ability to gain another {@status concentration} spell effect.

items: Abjuration: The dweomercat gains {@spell protection from energy} for 1 minute.
Conjuration: The dweomercat gains {@spell shield} for 1 round.
Divination: The dweomercat can {@spell detect evil and good} or {@spell detect thoughts} for 1 minute.
Enchantment: The dweomercat gains {@spell heroism} for 1 minute.

Evocation: The dweomercat reflects a portion of the spell's energy back at the caster, dealing a number of damage equal to the spell's level if the caster fails a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, or half as much damage if they succeed (minimum 1).
Illusion: The dweomercat gains {@spell invisibility} for 1 minute.
Necromancy: The dweomercat gains {@spell false life} for 1 minute.
Transmutation: The dweomercat gains the effect of {@spell magic weapon} on its bite and claws for 1 minute.

trait.name: Aura of Fear
entries: A creature that is within 10 feet of the banshee while it is conscious has disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}. Creatures that are normally immune to being {@condition frightened} lose their immunity to being {@condition frightened} while within 10 feet of the banshee but do not have disadvantage on their saving throws against becoming {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Hear Heartbeat
entries: The banshee can sense the beating hearts of living creatures within 60 feet, perceiving them as if the banshee had the {@sense blindsight} ability. It cannot detect plants, oozes, or amorphous creatures with this ability, nor any living creature that lacks a heartbeat.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. The banshee takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the banshee fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spectral Ripple
entries: When the banshee moves at least 10 feet during a round, it is treated as if it is lightly obscured until the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the banshee has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Terrifying Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) necrotic damage, and the target must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the target is under the effects of an ongoing spell or effect that protects against being {@condition frightened} (such as {@spell heroes' feast}), treat the Terrifying Touch as a {@spell dispel magic} spell against that effect.

action.name: Immortal Anguish
entries: Creatures within 60 feet of the banshee that are able to see and hear them must make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, a creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks for 1 minute. A creature that succeeds at a saving throw against this trait is immune for 24 hours.

action.name: Shout
entries: Creatures within 30 feet of the banshee must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) thunder damage on a failed save and becoming {@condition deafened} for 1 minute, and taking half as much damage on a success and not becoming {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Wail {@recharge}
entries: Hostile living creatures within 40 feet who can hear the banshee have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of the banshee's next turn and must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage and 28 ({@damage 8d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute; on a failure by 5 or more, the target is permanently {@condition deafened}. A target can make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns; on a success, the target is no longer {@condition frightened}. Any magical silence effect within range is treated as if the banshee had cast {@spell dispel magic}. The sound of the banshee's wail reverberates until the beginning of its next turn, and any creature coming within range is affected by these echoes as if it had been present when the banshee had wailed.

reaction.name: Vengeful Spite
entries: When an enemy within 40 feet critically hits the banshee or the banshee fails a saving throw against such an enemy's damaging effect, the banshee lashes back at its tormentor to evoke anguish and horror. The target must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage or half as much on a successful save. A creature failing its saving throw is also {@condition stunned}. The creature can attempt a new saving throw each round at the end of its turn to end the {@condition stunned} condition, though when the stun ends, it becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 round.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The banshee moves up to its full speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Shout (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The banshee uses its shout.

legendary.name: Terrifying Touch Attack
entries: The banshee makes one terrifying touch attack.

trait.name: Blinding Sickness
entries: Creatures that take damage from the elemental's slam or surge must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease blinding sickness|PKB}. A creature with {@disease blinding sickness|PKB} must repeat the saving throw at the end of each long rest, gaining one level of {@condition exhaustion} on a failure or reducing its {@condition exhaustion} level from this disease by one on a success. {@condition Exhaustion} from {@disease blinding sickness|PKB} can't be removed while the disease continues. A creature that reaches three levels of {@condition exhaustion} from {@disease blinding sickness|PKB} is permanently {@condition blinded}.

trait.name: Vortex
entries: Water within a 50-foot radius around the elemental is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for swimming non-elemental creatures.

trait.name: Water-Bound
entries: If the elemental is not touching water, it can't use reactions and it can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes three slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the elemental either pushes the target up to 10 feet away or pulls the target up to 10 feet toward itself.

action.name: Drench
entries: The elemental attempts to extinguish all fires within 50 feet of itself. If a fire is magical, the elemental makes a Strength saving throw with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the fire is extinguished.

action.name: Surge {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental quickly expands to fill the area of its vortex before retracting to its former space. Each creature within the vortex must make a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 20 feet away from the elemental. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

trait.name: Vortex
entries: Water within a 50-foot radius around the elemental is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for swimming non-elemental creatures.

trait.name: Water-Bound
entries: If the elemental is not touching water, it can't use reactions and it can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes three slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the elemental either pushes the target up to 10 feet away or pulls the target up to 10 feet toward itself.

action.name: Drench
entries: The elemental attempts to extinguish all fires within 20 feet of itself. If a fire is magical, the elemental makes a Strength saving throw with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the fire is extinguished.

action.name: Surge {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental quickly expands to fill the area of its vortex before retracting to its former space. Each creature within the vortex must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 20 feet away from the elemental. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The dragonfly doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Skimmersense
entries: The dragonfly can sense other creatures touching the same water, functioning as {@sense tremorsense|MM} with a range of 30 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the dragonfly can't {@action grapple} another target. The dragonfly can continue to bite by transferring the {@condition grappled} target to its limbs.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The flame drake has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Smokesense
entries: The flame drake can see through smoke. Smoke does not provide concealment against the flame drake.

trait.name: Speed Surge (3/Day)
entries: The flame drake can use {@action Dash} as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flame drake attacks twice: once with its bite and once with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fireball Breath {@recharge}
entries: The flame drake exhales a fireball to a point within 150 feet. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 40 ({@damage 9d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: The gnome has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The servant makes two knife melee attacks.

action.name: Knife
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 10/60 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The false priestess is an 8th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). She knows the following sorcerer spells:

trait.name: Distant Spell (2/Day)
entries: When the false priestess casts a spell with a range of 5 feet or more, she can double the range of the spell. When the false priestess casts a spell with a range of touch, she can increase the range to 30 feet.

trait.name: Primal Weapon
entries: The false priestess's melee weapon attacks deal an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage on a successful hit. This extra damage is already factored into the false priestess's attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The false priestess makes two attacks with her glaive.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The behemoth's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The behemoth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1: {@spell plane shift} (to or from the First World only)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The behemoth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The behemoth regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the behemoth takes fire or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the behemoth's next turn. The behemoth dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Tongues
entries: The behemoth can understand all spoken languages and can be understood by any creature that has a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The behemoth makes two fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The stalker's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The stalker can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1: {@spell plane shift} (to or from the First World only)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The stalker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The stalker regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the stalker takes fire or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the stalker's next turn. The stalker dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Tongues
entries: The stalker can understand all spoken languages and can be understood by any creature that has a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stalker makes four fetch weapon attacks.

action.name: Summoned Fetch Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. When the stalker manifests this weapon, it can choose its appearance, and can alter the damage type from slashing to bludgeoning or piercing.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Electric Torpor
entries: Although a froghemoth is immune to damage from lightning, whenever it would otherwise take such damage it is instead slowed—it cannot use Multiattack or reactions, and its movement speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The froghemoth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight. In addition, it can't be surprised, nor do enemies gain advantage against it for having their allies within 5 feet of the froghemoth.

trait.name: Otherworldly Vision
entries: A froghemoth's stalked eyes allow it to see in all directions at once. It cannot be {@variantrule Flanking|DMG|flanked} and can never be surprised. It also can perceive {@condition invisible} or ethereal creatures within 30 feet, and it automatically sees through all visual illusions within 30 feet.

trait.name: Prodigious Leap
entries: The froghemoth's long jump is up to 60 feet, and its high jump is up to 30 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The froghemoth makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the froghemoth. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth's turns. If the froghemoth takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the froghemoth must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the froghemoth. If the froghemoth dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the froghemoth can't attack with that tentacle until the {@action grapple} ends. The froghemoth has four tentacles and each can grapple only a single target. {@condition Restrained} creatures automatically take tentacle damage at the start of the froghemoth's turn.

action.name: Aquatic Ambush
entries: If the froghemoth is hidden in water and there is a creature within 40 feet that has not detected it, as an action the froghemoth can move up to 40 feet toward that creature over water and land in any combination and then make one attack against that creature with advantage on the attack roll. If the attack hits, the froghemoth can make a second attack against the same creature as a bonus action; it does not gain advantage on this attack roll.

reaction.name: Barbed Tongue
entries: When a ranged attack within 30 feet hits or misses the froghemoth, as a reaction, it can lash out with its tongue at the attacker. The target must make on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled to within 10 feet of the froghemoth, who makes a bite attack against the target.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghostly guard can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when they are on the First World, and vice versa.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the ghostly guard is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the ghostly guard instead takes no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghostly guard can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. They take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if they end their turn inside an object.

trait.name: Shame
entries: A ghostly guard has disadvantage with all rolls made against elves or those whom it believes are worshippers of Calistria. A character who understands the nature of this shame can attempt to forgive a ghostly guard (requiring an action by the forgiving creature) by speaking to it in a language it understands. The ghostly guard must attempt a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, the ghostly guard has disadvantage with all rolls until the end of its next turn. If it rolls a natural 1 on this saving throw, the ghostly guard fades away as it comes to terms with its death and its soul is released into the afterlife.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghostly guard makes two melee attacks with their withering touch.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}31 ({@damage 7d6 + 7}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghostly guard enters the Ethereal Plane from the First World, or vice versa. They are visible on the First World while they are in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet they can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the ghostly guard that can see them must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages {@dice 1d4  10} years. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the ghostly guard's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a {@spell greater restoration} spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

action.name: Possession {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid that the ghostly guard can see within 5 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by them; the ghostly guard then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The ghostly guard now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghostly guard can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and they retain their alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. They otherwise use the possessed target's statistics, but don't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghostly guard ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the ghostly guard reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to the ghostly guard's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

trait.name: Burn Alive
entries: As a bonus action, the statue roasts a creature it has {@condition grappled} in the fires that burn inside its hollow spheres. The target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The statue makes two attacks.

action.name: Sphere
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity save or be {@condition grappled} in one of the statues hollow spheres (escape {@dc 14}). The statue can hold up to 12 creatures in this way.

action.name: Flaming Coal
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 80/160 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant flytrap makes four bite attacks (one for each mouth).

action.name: Bite
