entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the giant flytrap can't bite another target with this mouth.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The giant flytrap makes one bite attack against a creature it is {@action grapple|PHB|grappling}. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the {@action grapple} ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover from attacks and other effects outside the giant flytrap, and it takes 9 ({@dice 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the giant flytrap's turns.

If the giant flytrap takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the creature inside it, the giant flytrap must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the giant flytrap. If the giant flytrap dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the flytrap's corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant whiptail centipede makes two attacks, one with its bite and one with its tail slap.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for one hour.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft. one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Goblin Pox
entries: A creature exposed to {@disease goblin pox|PKB} must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become afflicted with {@disease goblin pox|PKB}. On a successful saving throw, it is immune to {@disease goblin pox|PKB} for 24 hours. A creature with {@disease goblin pox|PKB} is {@condition poisoned} and must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failed save, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turns, but not both. The creature can then repeat the saving throw after each long rest, ending the effects on itself on a success. Goblins and goblin dogs are immune to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}.

trait.name: Irritating Dander
entries: A creature that hits a goblin bat-dog with an unarmed attack, tries to {@action grapple} it, or otherwise touches it is exposed to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The goblin bat-dog has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing and smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dander Dusting (Recharge after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The goblin bat-dog flaps its wings furiously, causing a noxious cloud of dander to fill the air in a 5-foot radius around it. All creatures in the area of effect are exposed to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}, and any creature other than a goblin, {@creature goblin dog|PKB}, or goblin bat-dog must succeed at a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the beginning of the goblin bat-dog's next turn.

action.name: Horsechopper
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Goblin Scuttle
entries: When a nonhostile creature the goblin can see ends its movement within 5 feet of the goblin, the goblin moves up to 5 feet. The goblin doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with this movement.

trait.name: Goblin Pox
entries: A creature exposed to {@disease goblin pox|PKB} must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become afflicted with {@disease goblin pox|PKB}. On a successful saving throw, it is immune to {@disease goblin pox|PKB} for 24 hours.

A creature with {@disease goblin pox|PKB} is {@condition poisoned} and must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failed save, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turns, but not both. The creature can then repeat the saving throw after each long rest, ending the effects on itself on a success. Goblins and goblin dogs are immune to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}.

trait.name: Irritating Dander
entries: A creature that touches the goblin dog or hits the goblin dog with an unarmed strike is exposed to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The goblin dog has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scratch
entries: The goblin dog vigorously scratches itself, exposing all creatures within 5 feet of it to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}.

reaction.name: Juke
entries: When the goblin dog is given an order by a creature mounted to it, the goblin dog moves up to 5 feet. The goblin dog doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with this movement.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The goblin pyro is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Torch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 1 fire damage.

reaction.name: Goblin Scuttle
entries: When a nonhostile creature the goblin can see ends its movement within 5 feet of the goblin, the goblin moves up to 5 feet. The goblin doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with this movement.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The war chanter is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Dogslicer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Goblin Song
entries: The war chanter sings annoying goblin songs. Each creature within 60 feet of the war chanter that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become distracted for 1 minute. Distracted creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

reaction.name: Goblin Scuttle
entries: When a nonhostile creature the goblin can see ends its movement within 5 feet of the goblin, the goblin moves up to 5 feet. The goblin doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with this movement.

trait.name: Carry Off Prey
entries: The gogiteth can move at its full speed while {@action grapple|PHB|grappling} a creature, moving the creature with it.

trait.name: Relentless Hunter
entries: The gogiteth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made to track creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gogiteth makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its legs.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage at the start of each of the gogiteth's turns, and the gogiteth can't bite another target.

action.name: Leg
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Skittering Assault
entries: The gogiteth moves up to its speed three times, making a leg attack against a different creature within reach each time it moves.

reaction.name: Skittering Reposition
entries: When a creature the gogiteth can see moves within 10 feet of its space, the gogiteth can move up to 10 feet. The gogiteth doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with this movement.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The graveknight's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The graveknight can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Graveknight's Curse
entries: A living creature that dons the graveknight's armor must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or be afflicted with the graveknight's curse. Cursed creatures cannot remove the graveknight's armor and must repeat the saving throw at the end of each long rest. On a second failed save, the creature has disadvantage on death saving throws. On a third failed save, the creature's speed is halved. On a fourth failed save, the creature dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight. A successful saving throw lifts the curse, and the armor falls off. The creature is subject to the curse if it dons the armor again.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If a graveknight is destroyed, its armor regrows its body in {@dice 1d10} days. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts. A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor with a {@spell disintegrate} spell, transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or by throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

trait.name: Ruinous Energy
entries: The graveknight presented here is infused with cold, but others can be infused with acid, {@homebrew lightning|electricity}, or fire. A graveknight is immune to damage type of its ruinous energy, and its attacks and devastating blast deal additional damage of this energy type.

trait.name: Sacrilegious Aura
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the graveknight uses a spell or ability that magically restores hit points, the creature must make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature's spell or ability fails and has no effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The graveknight makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Devastating Blast {@recharge}
entries: The graveknight unleashes a 30-foot cone of energy. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The blast's damage is the same type as its ruinous energy, cold, for this graveknight.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The graveknight adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the graveknight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

items.name: Ruinous Energy
entries: The graveknight presented here is infused with {{damageType}}. A graveknight is immune to damage type of its ruinous energy, and its attacks and devastating blast deal additional damage of this energy type.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The graveknight makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) {{damageType}} damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) {{damageType}} damage.

action.name: Devastating Blast {@recharge}
entries: The graveknight unleashes a 30-foot cone of energy. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) {{damageType}} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The barghest's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). A barghest can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The barghest can use its action to polymorph into a {@creature goblin} or a {@creature wolf}, or back into its true form. While the barghest is a {@creature goblin} it loses its bite and claw attacks, it becomes Small, its move speed becomes 30 feet, and it gains the Nimble Escape ability. When the barghest is a {@creature wolf}, its speed changes to 40 feet and it gains the Knockdown ability.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: While in its {@creature goblin} form, the barghest can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} actions as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Knockdown
entries: While in its {@creature wolf} form, if the barghest hits with a bite attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The barghest has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Mutation
entries: The process of consuming corpses to evolve into a greater barghest results in odd and unpredictable physiological changes. In Nargloom's case, this mutation is the formation of a pair of bat wings that grant him a fly speed of 30 feet while in his true form. (Unlike most greater barghests, Nargloom also possesses a third eye in his forehead, but this doesn't grant him any additional abilities of note.)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The barghest makes three attacks, one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Command Plants
entries: The grimstalker can magically command any plant within 30 feet of him, using a limited telepathy. Plants never attack the grimstalker unless compelled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grimstalker makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Erosion Aura
entries: Any creature within 120 feet of the guthallath loses all of its damage resistances, and objects in the aura take double damage. If a creature starts its turn within the guthallath's aura, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The guthallath has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The guthallath's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the guthallath fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guthallath makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}) and is {@condition restrained} until the {@action grapple} ends. The guthallath has two hands, each of which can only {@action grapple} one target.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}

action.name: Deadly Throw
entries: One Huge or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the guthallath is thrown up to 50 feet in any direction and is knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Annihilation Beams {@recharge 5}
entries: The guthallath shoots beams from its eyes in a 120-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) force damage. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The guthallath makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The guthallath makes a stomp attack.

legendary.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The guthallath moves up to 40 feet in a straight line and can move through the spaces of Huge or smaller creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. The guthallath makes one stomp attack against each creature and object as it moves through their space. On a hit, a creature must also succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

resist.note: from non-magical weapons (due to the resilient hide armor)

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the giant deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the giant that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the giant doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes a battleaxe and hatchet attack.

action.name: Battleaxe +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hatchet +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 8d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Thrown Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Wide Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant swings its battleaxe in a circle around itself, and every creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) slashing damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Twin Butchery (Only a target under the effects of Menace Prey)
entries: So long as the giant is wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand and hits his menaced prey twice in the same round it deals an additional {@damage 2d6} damage and the giant has advantage on its next attack roll against the target.

action.name: Menace Prey
entries: The giant designates up to two creatures it can see and hear, or one they're tracking, as their prey. The target becomes marked. While marked, the giant gains a +2 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track the prey. If the giant scores a critical hit against the marked target they are automatically {@condition frightened} of the giant for one minute. Targets are marked for up to 24 hours, or until the giant uses this ability again.

reaction.name: Catch Rock
entries: The giant can attempt to catch a rock thrown at a target that is within 10 feet of itself. The giant makes a Dexterity saving throw against the attack roll of the attacking creature. If it succeeds, the giant catches the rock and the intended target takes no damage.

trait.name: Perfect Aim
entries: The first time the hobgoblin hits with a crossbow attack in a round, they deal an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hobgoblin makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) slashing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hodag makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or tail slap.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has twelve heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra attacks with as many bite attacks as it has heads, with a maximum of twelve.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hunter is a 15th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). They know the following ranger spells:
footerEntries: *The hunter casts this spell on themself before combat if possible.

trait.name: Favored Enemy:
entries: Beasts and Any Two Humanoids. The hunter gains advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to search for their favored enemies and on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track them.

trait.name: Forest Walker
entries: The hunter ignores the effects of {@quickref difficult terrain||3} from a forest environment. They can sneak through underbrush without a {@skill Stealth} check as long as the hunter moves no more than 5 feet at a time and is not within 10 feet of an enemy at any point during their movement.

trait.name: Precision Edge
entries: The first time the hunter hits their favored enemy in a round, they deal an additional 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hunter makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The irlgaunt's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}). The irlgaunt can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Stone Step
entries: The irlgaunt ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3} composed of rocks and stone.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The irlgaunt makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its stomps.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Regurgitate Gastrolith {@recharge 5}
entries: The irlgaunt violently regurgitates a melon-sized clot infused with digestive enzymes at a point it can see within 30 feet of it. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw as the clot explodes on impact, taking 21 ({@dice 6d6}) piercing and 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Jaws That Bite
entries: The jabberwock's bite attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the jabberwock fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The jabberwock has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Planar Acclimation
entries: The jabberwock treats the plane it is currently on as its native plane.

trait.name: Vorpal Fear
entries: If the jabberwock takes damage from a {@item vorpal sword}, it becomes {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Whiffling
entries: The jabberwock can use a bonus action when it flies or makes a wing attack during its turn, causing severe winds in a 30-foot radius around it. These winds move outward from the jabberwock and last until the start of its next turn. All other creatures besides the jabberwock within the area of effect move as if in {@quickref difficult terrain||3} and must succeed at a {@dc 24} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to move toward the jabberwock.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jabberwock uses Manxome Foe, then makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Burble {@recharge 5}
entries: The jabberwock creates a blast of strange noises and shouted nonsense in the various languages it knows (and invariably some languages it doesn't know), creating one of the following effects.

items.name: Burble (Maddening)
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the jabberwock must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or be subjected to the effects of {@spell confusion} for 1 minute.

items.name: Burble (Thundering)
entries: Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 87 ({@damage 25d6}) thunder damage, is {@condition stunned} until the end of the jabberwock's next turn, and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A creature that succeeds takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition deafened} and {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Eyes of Flame
entries: {@atk r} {@hit 14} to hit, range 60/120 ft., two targets within 30 feet of each other. {@h}56 ({@damage 16d6}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Manxome Foe
entries: The presence of a jabberwock is terrifying to its enemies. Each creature of the jabberwock's choice that is within 120 feet of the jabberwock and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the jabberwock's Manxome Foe for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Claws That Catch
entries: If a creature within 10 feet of the jabberwock takes the {@action Use an Object} action, moves from its square, or makes a ranged attack, the jabberwock can make a claw attack against the creature. If the attack hits, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and unable to move until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The jabberwock makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Eyes of Flame (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The jabberwock makes an Eyes of Flame attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The jabberwock beats its wings. Each creature within 20 feet of the jabberwock must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The jabberwock can then fly up to half its flying speed.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The giant can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, {@quickref difficult terrain||3} composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Giant's Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the giant can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the giant is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the giant gains the following benefits:

items: The giant has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the giant gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
The giant has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The giant regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the giant takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The giant dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two attacks with its greataxe.

action.name: Greataxe of Striking +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) slashing damage, or 32 ({@damage 3d12 + 13}) slashing damage while raging. The greataxe has {@dice 1d10} charges (minimum of 3) at the start of the encounter. When the giant hits with a melee attack, it can expend up to 3 of its charges. For each charge it expends, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage. The greataxe otherwise functions as a {@item staff of striking|DMG} but is sized for a Huge giant.

action.name: Wide Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant swings its battle axe in a circle around itself, Every creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) slashing damage, or 32 ({@damage 3d12 + 13}) slashing damage if the giant is raging, and the target is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The giant can expend charges from its greataxe of striking to increase this damage and rage bonuses also apply.

action.name: Chill Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant exhales a 15-foot cone of moisture that freezes. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is also {@condition grappled} in ice (escape {@dc 16}), and while {@condition grappled} in this way, the creature is {@condition restrained} and takes 24 ({@damage 7d6}) cold damage at the end of each of its turns.

action.name: Thrown Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.
{@note Blank in source, assumed same as {@creature Hill Giant Butcher|PKB}.}

The giant can attempt to catch a rock thrown at a target that is within 10 feet of itself. The giant makes a Dexterity saving throw against the attack roll of the attacking creature. If it succeeds, the giant catches the rock and the intended target takes no damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kellid graveknight's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). The kellid graveknight can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Graveknight's Curse
entries: A living creature that dons the kellid graveknight's armor must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or be afflicted with the graveknight's curse. Cursed creatures cannot remove the kellid graveknight's armor and must repeat the saving throw at the end of each long rest. On a second failed save, the creature has disadvantage on death saving throws. On a third failed save, the creature's speed is halved. On a fourth failed save, the creature dies and transforms into the armor's kellid graveknight. A successful saving throw lifts the curse, and the armor falls off. The creature is subject to the curse if it dons the armor again.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If a kellid graveknight is destroyed, its armor regrows its body in {@dice 1d10} days. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts. A kellid graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor with a {@spell disintegrate} spell, transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or by throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

trait.name: Ruinous Energy
entries: A Kellid graveknight is infused with cold. It is immune to cold damage, and its attacks and devastating blast deal cold damage as indicated below.

trait.name: Sacrilegious Aura
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the kellid graveknight uses a spell or ability that magically restores hit points, the creature must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature's spell or ability fails and has no effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kellid graveknight makes three maul attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Devastating Blast {@recharge}
entries: The kellid graveknight unleashes a 30-foot cone of cold. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The kellid graveknight adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the kellid graveknight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Hurried Retreat
entries: The kobold scout can {@action Disengage} as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The kobold deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the kobold that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the kobold doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The krooth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Augment Critical
entries: If the krooth scores a critical hit, it rolls damage dice three times instead of twice.

trait.name: Fearless
entries: The krooth has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The krooth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The krooth makes one bite attack and one tail spike attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If a krooth hits a target creature with its bite attack, it can snap off one of its teeth in the wound. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned}; the {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Leng envoy's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Leng Ruby
entries: Many denizens of Leng carry strange rubies mined from quarries in Leng. As long as a creature holds a Leng ruby that it willingly accepted as a gift or payment from a denizen of Leng, any denizen of Leng can target that creature with any divination spell it knows at a range of 1 mile, and the target has disadvantage on the saving throw. A typical Leng envoy carries {@dice 1d6} rubies when encountered.

trait.name: No Breath
entries: The Leng envoy doesn't need to breathe.

trait.name: Planar Regeneration
entries: A denizen of Leng maintains a connection to the demiplane of Leng at all times, and when away from Leng, they gain 15 hit points at the start of each round. They lose this ability on Leng or in areas where planar connections do not function. If killed, their body dissolves into nothingness in one minute, leaving their equipment behind. A slain denizen reforms in Leng; they can be permanently killed only when their planar regeneration doesn't function.

trait.name: Unusual Anatomy
entries: A denizen's internal anatomy varies from individual to individual and grants the Leng envoy resistance to all sneak attack and critical hit damage no matter the source.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Leng envoy makes three melee attacks or makes one melee attack and casts a spell.

action.name: Debilitating Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage and the target takes {@dice 1d6} Dexterity Ability damage. This damage can be healed normally but a target reduced to 0 Dexterity is {@condition paralyzed} until it regains 1 point.

action.name: Greater Striking Keen Kukri +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d4 + 7}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage, and the target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell the Leng envoy casts before the end of the Leng envoy's next turn. This weapon scores a critical hit on a 19 or 20. On a critical hit, the weapon inflicts an aberrant wound and the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns for 1 minute. The wound closes if the target receives magical healing.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (1 to 3 actions)
entries: The Leng envoy can cast one of its spells: an at-will spell costs 1 action, a 3/day spell costs 2 actions, and a 1/day spell costs 3 actions each.

legendary.name: Sudden Action
entries: The Leng envoy attacks with its debilitating bite or attacks with its kukri.

legendary.name: Play the Pipes (1/Day)
entries: So long as the Leng envoy is holding a musical instrument, it can play a melody to cast {@spell Otto's Irresistible Dance|PHB|irresistible dance}, unfathomable song to cast {@spell confusion}, or a trancelike dirge to cast {@spell feeblemind}. The spell targets all creatures in a 60-foot sphere centered on the Leng envoy instead of its usual targets. A creature that succeeds at its saving throw ({@dc 18}) against any spell is immune from all spells played from the envoy's pipes for 1 minute. Aberrations are immune to this music.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lerritan's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1e: {@spell plane shift} (only to the Elemental Planes of Earth and Fire, as well as the Material Plane)

trait.name: Magical Weapons
entries: The lerritan's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lerritan makes three attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Thrown Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 120/360 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Volcanic Eruption {@recharge 5}
entries: The volcano on the lerritan's back erupts and sends lava bombs raining down in a 30-foot radius. Creatures in this area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 ({@damage 14d12}) fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. The lava globules quickly cool into heavy stones, transforming the area into {@quickref difficult terrain||3} creatures that aren't elementals. A creature that fails their saving throw by 5 or more against this effect are {@condition restrained} by the globules until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Jaws That Bite
entries: The lesser jabberwock's bite attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Planar Acclimation
entries: The lesser jabberwock treats the plane it is currently on as its native plane.

trait.name: Vorpal Fear
entries: If the lesser jabberwock takes damage from a {@item vorpal sword|DMG}, it becomes {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Whiffling
entries: The lesser jabberwock can use a bonus action when it flies or makes a wing attack during its turn, causing severe winds in a 30-foot radius around it. These winds move outward from the lesser jabberwock and last until the start of its next turn. All other creatures besides the lesser jabberwock within the area of effect move as if in {@quickref difficult terrain||3} and must succeed at a {@dc 22} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to move toward the lesser jabberwock.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lesser jabberwock uses Manxome Foe, then makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Burble {@recharge 5}
entries: The lesser jabberwock creates a blast of strange noises and shouted nonsense in the various languages it knows (and invariably some languages it doesn't know), creating one of the following effects.

items.name: Burble (Maddening)
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the lesser jabberwock must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be subjected to the effects of {@spell confusion} for 1 minute.

items.name: Burble (Thundering)
entries: Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A creature that succeeds takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Eyes of Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Manxome Foe
entries: The very presence of a lesser jabberwock is terrifying to its enemies. Each creature of the lesser jabberwock's choice that is within 120 feet of the lesser jabberwock and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the lesser jabberwock's Manxome Foe for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Claws That Catch
entries: If a creature within 10 feet of the lesser jabberwock takes the {@action Use An Object} action, moves from its square, or makes a ranged attack, the lesser jabberwock can make a claw attack against the creature as a reaction. If the attack hits, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and unable to move until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The lesser jabberwock makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Eyes of Flame (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The lesser jabberwock makes an Eyes of Flame attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lesser jabberwock beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the lesser jabberwock must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The lesser jabberwock can then fly up to half its flying speed.

trait.name: Language Adaptation
entries: A leucrotta can learn any language it hears spoken for at least 10 minutes, adding it to its languages known and replacing the language it previously learned using this ability. In the Stolen Lands, a leucrotta typically knows Jotun as the language granted by this ability.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The leucrotta can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leucrotta makes three melee attacks: one with its bite and two with its hooves.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hoof
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Lure
entries: While hidden from view, the leucrotta uses its voice to charm up to twelve creatures within 60 feet of itself that it can see. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be affected by {@spell mass suggestion}. On a success, a creature is immune to this leucrotta's lure for the next 24 hours. If the leucrotta uses the victim's name during the lure, the target has disadvantage on its saving throw.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The leukodaemon's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Daemonic Pestilence
entries: A creature likely contracts {@disease daemonic pestilence|PKB} from being attacked by or in close proximity to a leukodaemon. A creature that starts its turn within 50 feet of a leukodaemon must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease daemonic pestilence|PKB}. A creature with this disease establishes a telepathic link with the leukodaemon that conferred this disease. The range of this mental connection is unlimited, even spanning across planes. The creature must also make a Constitution saving throw each day after a long rest, gaining a level of {@condition exhaustion} instead of recovering one on a failure. {@disease Daemonic pestilence|PKB} persists until the target accrues 6 successes against the disease.

trait.name: Plaguebearer
entries: The leukodaemon is immune to disease, but can contract them for the purposes of spreading them.

trait.name: Plaguesense
entries: A leukodaemon senses any creature within 60 feet that has a disease. It knows the type and current stage of all diseases carried by such creatures.

trait.name: Infectious Aura
entries: The leukodaemon radiates a 30 feet radius aura of infection. All creatures that start their turn inside of this aura have disadvantage on saving throws against contracting or resisting diseases.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leukodaemon makes one claw attack and one bite attack, or three {@item +1 longbow|DMG} attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease daemonic pestilence|PKB}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease daemonic pestilence|PKB}.

action.name: Longbow +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease daemonic pestilence|PKB}.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The leukodaemon exhales a cloud of corpse-bloated, biting black flies in a 20-foot cone. A creature within the cone must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) piercing damage and becoming {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The logger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The logger makes two handaxe attacks.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The marsh giant's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The marsh giant can breathe both air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marsh giant makes three attacks: it attacks once with its gaff and twice with its slam or makes two thrown rock attacks. It can make a hook shake action in place of its gaff attack.

action.name: +1 Gaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning or piercing damage, and the creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the marsh giant can't use its gaff on another target.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d4 + 6}) bludgeoning or piercing damage.

action.name: Thrown Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@dice 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning.

action.name: Hook Shake
entries: The marsh giant shakes a creature it has {@condition grappled} by its gaff, shaking it violently. The creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) piercing damage on a failure and, if the target is underwater, it begins suffocating if it wasn't already, as its breath is forced from its lungs.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mastiff of Tindalos's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mastiff of Tindalos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The mastiff of Tindalos's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Otherworldly Mind
entries: Whenever a creature targets the mastiff with a mental effect or attack (psychic damage, mind reading, charm, enchantments or similar attacks) that creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage on a failed {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or half damage on success. If the creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also becomes confused for 1 minute as the {@spell confusion} spell.

trait.name: Ripping Gaze
entries: The mastiff of Tindalos's eyes glow balefully, causing painful but bloodless wounds to tear open upon the body of a creature that meets its awful gaze. When a creature that can see the mastiff's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the mastiff, the mastiff can force the creature to make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw if the mastiff isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. The creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) slashing damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw by 5 or more is immune to this mastiff's gaze for 24 hours.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the mastiff until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the mastiff in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. The mastiff is immune to its own the gaze and the gaze of other hounds of Tindalos.

trait.name: Vulnerable to Curved Space
entries: When a mastiff of Tindalos is not adjacent to a structural angle of 90 or smaller, its resistance to physical damage is suppressed and it gains the {@condition poisoned} condition. It can't recover from this condition, but the condition ends once the mastiff is again adjacent to a suitable angle.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mastiff can use angled entry and then makes three attacks: one with its jaws and two with its claws.

action.name: Jaws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Angled Entry
entries: The mastiff of Tindalos teleports up to 120 feet to an angle of 90 (or more acute) it can see.
Once per day, the mastiff can use this ability to plane shift to or from the Dimension of Time, with the same restrictions on what angles it can appear next to.

action.name: Dimensional Anchor (1/Day)
entries: The mastiff of Tindalos targets a creature it can see within 120 feet of it The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be tied firmly to the plane it is currently in. Teleportation of any sort is impossible for the creature for 10 minutes. This effect is ended by {@spell dispel magic} or similar magic. Dimensional anchor does not prevent summoned creatures from disappearing after the duration of the spell that summoned them.

trait.name: Scent
entries: The mastodon can use its scent to detect creatures within 60 feet, but not pinpoint their location.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the mastodon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits with a gore attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the mastodon can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mastodon makes two stomp attacks. One stomp attack can be replaced by a trunk attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 5d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@dice 4d8 + 8}) bludgeoning.

action.name: Trunk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the mastodon can't use its trunk on another target.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mitflit's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}). The mite can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Hatred
entries: Mitflits double their proficiency bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures of the dwarf or gnome subtype due to special training against these hated foes.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The mitflit has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Self-Loathing
entries: A mitflit's self-loathing makes them easy to influence. They have disadvantage on saving throws and ability checks to resist any Charisma-based skills or being {@condition charmed}.

trait.name: Vermin Keeper
entries: Through sounds and gestures, the mitflit can communicate simple ideas with arthropods. The knowledge and awareness of arthropods is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, they can give information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. The mitflit can ask for small favors from arthropods, and has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks when communicating with them.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Vengeful
entries: When the mitflit is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, the mitflit makes an attack against the creature that harmed it.

trait.name: Enraged Cunning
entries: A murder of crows can hound its prey through most barriers. Simple latches, unsecured chimney flues, loosely shuttered windows, and similar obstacles rarely keep a murder of crows away. A murder of crows automatically bypasses many of these simple obstructions and can attempt a {@dc 15} Dexterity ability check to get through more complex obstructions (such as closed windows or simple barricades).

trait.name: Distracting Horde
entries: Creatures that share the swarm's space or are within 5 feet of it have disadvantage on attack rolls and Constitution saving throws to maintain {@status concentration}. The area of the swarm is considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The Swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny beast. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm can attack every creature in its space with swarming beaks.

action.name: Swarming Beaks
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or lower, and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition blinded} until the end of the swarm's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nabasu's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Death-Stealing Gaze
entries: The nabasu exudes an aura of death in a 30-foot radius. Creatures that end their turns in this aura must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they gain a level of {@condition exhaustion}, and the nabasu gains 10 temporary hit points. A creature that dies while subject to the effects of this {@condition exhaustion} level rises as a {@creature ghoul|MM} at the next midnight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nabasu has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nabasu makes two melee attacks: one with its bite, and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The nabasu magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 100 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
entries: The nabasu chooses a demon to summon and attempts a magical summoning. The nabasu has a 50 percent chance of summoning {@dice 1d4} {@creature shadow|MM|shadows}, or 1 {@creature barlgura|MM}. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

trait.name: Three Heads
entries: The chimera has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}. Any ability that would sever a chimera's head (such as a critical hit with a vorpal weapon) severs one head at random. Losing a head doesn't kill the chimera (as long as it has at least one head left), but it does prevent it from making attacks with the lost head (reducing its overall number of attacks). If the chimera loses the dragon head, it loses the Dragon Breath ability.

trait.name: Triple Opportunity
entries: The chimera gains 2 extra reactions each round that it can use only to make {@action opportunity attack|PHB|attacks of opportunity}. It must use a different head for each reaction, and it can't use more than one on the same triggering action. If it loses one of its heads, it also loses the corresponding extra reaction.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chimera makes four attacks, one with each head and one with its claws.

action.name: Dragon Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage based on the color of the dragon head: fire for red, poison for green, cold for white, lightning for blue, and acid for black.

action.name: Lion Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Goat Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dragon Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The chimera breathes a 60-foot cone or line from its dragon head. All creatures in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity save, taking 45 ({@damage 13d6}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save. The color of the chimera's dragon head determines the shape of the Dragon Breath and the type of damage it deals: fire cone for red, poison cone for green, cold cone for white, lightning line for blue, and acid line for black.

items.name: Dragon Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) {{damageType}} damage.

items.name: Dragon Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The chimera breathes a 60-foot {{aoe}} from its dragon head. All creatures in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity save, taking 45 ({@damage 13d6}) {{damageType}} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The piscodaemon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The piscodaemon can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The piscodaemon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The piscodaemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: See Invisibility
entries: The piscodaemon has a constant {@spell see invisibility} effect as per the spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The piscodaemon makes two claw attacks and one tentacles attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: A Pitax warden is a 5th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). They have the following bard spells known:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Pitax warden makes three greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Favored Enemy:
entries: Beasts. The poacher gains advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to search for their favored enemies and on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track them.

trait.name: Precision Edge
entries: The first time the poacher hits a beast in a round, they deal an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The poacher makes two attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The risen fetch's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). The fetch can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1: {@spell plane shift} (to or from the First World only)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fetch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The fetch regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the stalker takes fire or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the risen fetch's next turn. The fetch dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Shadow of Death
entries: When the fetch scores a critical hit on a foe with its fetch weapon, it can use a bonus action to cast {@spell phantasmal killer} against that target with its innate spellcasting.

trait.name: Tongues
entries: The fetch can understand all spoken languages and can be understood by any creature that has a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The risen fetch makes four weapon attacks.

action.name: Summoned Fetch Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage. When the risen fetch manifests this weapon, it can choose its appearance, and can alter the damage type from slashing to bludgeoning or piercing.

trait.name: Long Neck
entries: An elasmosaurus's long neck allows it to interact with the surface while its body remains submerged underwater. While submerged no deeper than 15 feet underwater, an elasmosaurus can still stick its head up to breathe. An elasmosaurus gains three-quarters cover against attacks made against creatures who are above the water's surface while it is underwater, even if its head is above the surface.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Elasmosaurus makes one jaws and two paddle attacks per round.

action.name: Jaws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage. On a hit, the elasmosaurus attempts to drag its opponent below the water's surface. The opponent must make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw contested by the elasmosaurus's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. If the elasmosaurus succeeds, the foe is {@condition grappled} and pulled 5 feet toward the elasmosaurus's body. If the target fails by 5 or more, it is moved 10 feet toward the elasmosaurus. Until this {@action grapple} ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the elasmosaurus can't grab another target.

action.name: Paddle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Thrashing Retreat
entries: A swimming elasmosaurus thrashes the area around it as it attempts to flee. It makes two paddle attacks, each of which must be against separate targets. It then swims up to its swim speed, not provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|attacks of opportunity} when it swims out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Brutal Beating
entries: The ruffian's brutality shakes foes' confidence. Once per turn, the ruffian can deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage to one creature they hit with an attack if they have advantage on the attack roll. The target must succeed at a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. Whether or not the save is successful, the ruffian can knock the target up to 10 feet away. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Hold and Beat
entries: The ruffian has advantage on attack rolls against creatures it is {@action grapple|PHB|grappling}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ruffian makes two attacks.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Sister of the Bloodshot Eye is a 10th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Madness
entries: Any enemy within 30 feet of the Sister of the Bloodshot Eye must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become confused, as per the spell {@spell confusion}. If the creature moves more than 30 feet from the Sister of the Bloodshot Eye, the effect ends immediately.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The snapping flytrap makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) piercing.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 150 ft./600 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy a creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small ant. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm can attack every creature in its space with swarming bites.

action.name: Swarming Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@dice 2d6}) if the swarm has half of its hit points or lower, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of the swarm's next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much poison damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

reaction.name: Cling
entries: When a creature leaves the swarm's space, the army ant swarm can use its reaction to cling to that creature. If it does so, the amount of the swarm that was in the target's space moves with the creature, splitting the swarm if the creature is Medium or smaller. Each part of the swarm acts on the same initiative. The clinging swarm has one-quarter of the swarm's remaining hit points, removing those hit points from the swarm's current total. Any separated portion of the swarm can continue to make swarming bite attacks. A creature can use its action to brush the ants off with a contested {@action grapple} check. If underwater or in high winds, the creature has advantage on its ability check.
With a success, the creature removes itself from the swarm's area, and the remaining ants return to the main swarm without provoking an {@action Opportunity Attack|PHB|attack of opportunity}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
headerEntries: The mephit can innately cast {@spell stinking cloud}, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}).

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of high-pressure water. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary puddle of water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The water mephit makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge}
entries: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of acid. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsterFluff.name: Accomplished Mitflit
entries: These two mitflits {@homebrew (Dingetooth and Uurch)} are more accomplished than most of their kind, although their choice to focus their efforts on a marble launcher might not be the most efficient use of their training. You can use these statistics for any mitflit gremlin that's managed the luck and skill to live long enough to hone their combat prowess—whether or not you let them keep their marble launcher. Of course, switching the type of damage the marble launcher deals when it hits a target also lets you change the launcher into a {@creature Accomplished Mitflit (Glass Slinger)|PKB|glass slinger (slashing damage)}, a {@creature Accomplished Mitflit (Coal Flinger)|PKB|coal flinger (fire damage)}, or a {@creature Accomplished Mitflit (Poison Toad-Launcher)|PKB|poison toad-launcher (poison damage)}.

monsterFluff.name: Adamantine Golem
entries: Crafted from a nigh-indestructible black metal of great rarity, adamantine golems are legendary in their danger, for destroying them completely requires weapons forged of the same metal they are built of or the use of powerful magic. They typically are enormous constructs with imposing, bulky facades, but some crafters build smaller, sleeker adamantine golems (such as the ones encountered in the Lantern Kingdom). Regardless of their size, though, these powerful constructs represent some of the most deadly foes of their kind any adventurer might face in their careers.

monsterFluff.name: Aecora Silverfire
entries: Aecora Silverfire is the leader of the Nomen tribe of centaurs who dwell in the easternmost reaches of the Stolen Lands. You can use Aecora's stats for any Desna-worshipping centaur, such as a potential ally wandering PCs might encounter in the wild. If you do so, though, consider changing her alignment from chaotic neutral to chaotic good, since most worshippers of the goddess of luck and travel are, like her, more kind and forgiving in nature than Aecora is.

monsterFluff.name: Agai
entries: Agai is the leader of the Culcheck spriggans, the band who invades the village of Varnhold after {@creature Vordakai|PKB} steals away its people. While Agai can work well in your game as the leader of other spriggan enclaves, he also works well as an unusual member of a rival adventuring party, particularly one based on a composition of more monstrous members than a group composed mostly of humans and other core options.

monsterFluff.name: Akiros Ismort
entries: Akiros Ismort is a fallen paladin who joined the {@creature Stag Lord|PKB|Stag Lord's} bandits, but has come to realize that particular lifestyle is even more hollow than he anticipated. His unusual class combination makes him a great choice for any sort of "fallen knight" in your game—someone who has abandoned civilization to live in the wild, perhaps. Whether or not he can be redeemed and returned to his prior faith is left to your party to decide.

monsterFluff.name: Akuzhail
entries: Transformed and mutated by the Cult of the Bloom, the warped chimera Akuzhail is now the host of the {@creature bloom of Lamashtu|PKB} {@homebrew |(page 122)}. While you can use Akuzhail as a unique mutant chimera in your own game, you can also use these statistics to represent an entire species of variant chimeras—perhaps a pride of these monsters dwell in the Mana Wastes, or maybe they're genetically engineered creatures that break loose from a buried zoological ship module in Numeria. They could even be used in play as fleshwarp monstrosities from Thassilon, Nexian fleshforges, or drow laboratories, especially if you change their narrative description from that of chimeras with the heads of vultures, centipedes, and rattlesnakes to something even more outlandish.

monsterFluff.name: Alasen
entries: The weretiger Alasen can be encountered in {@creature Castruccio Irovetti|PKB|King Irovetti's} palace in Pitax, where she's been staying as a guest. In Kingmaker, she's the leader of the Catspaw Mercenaries, but she can work just as well as the leader of any group of bandits or, even better, a tiger-themed thieves' guild.
